conclusion: The problem involves maximizing the power-source output efficiency using given resistors and a power source.
The graph shows the terminal voltage \( U \) versus current \( I \) for the power source and resistors \( R_1 \) and \( R_2 \).
The slope of the power source's line gives the internal resistance \( r \).
The slope for \( R_1 \) is 1 \( \Omega \) and for \( R_2 \) is 1.5 \( \Omega \).
Maximum power transfer occurs when the external resistance equals the internal resistance of the source.
The parallel configuration maximizes the power output efficiency.
Connect resistors \( R_1 \) and \( R_2 \) in parallel to maximize the power-source output efficiency.
